Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2010 04:29PM holisternatir wrote: I was diagnosed in January of 09 and have liver mets.  Did taxol, carboplatin, nd herceptin for HER2+ for six months -- am still doing Herceptin for HER2+ for six months - also take Fumara for the Estrogen receptor +.  Right now after scans in December, I am NED (no evidence of disease) -- all of the lesions in my liver cleared (I had about ten lesions).  Now we scan every 3 months and hope it stays away for a long, long time.  Have the biopsy -- your oncologist needs to know what type of cancer he/she is dealing with -- how do you know for sure it is berast cancer that spread to the liver and not a secondary cancer of the liver? I had the liver biopsy and while I was afraid to have it -- it was not bad at all.  If it is a secondary cancer, the chemotherapy drugs used for breast cancer may not treat the liver cancer.  My oncologist specializes only in breast cancer (he's #3 in this country) and he won't treat a patient until he has all the facts -- and you can't get those facts without scans, biopsies, etc.  I wish you the best...keep fighting, it's worth the fight.
Posts.Title: Liver Mets- what's the prognosis makmak LivingIt
